title: Premier Insurance Offer for NCE Members
summary: This page introduces a group hospital fixed indemnity and group accident insurance plan offered exclusively to NCE members. It is underwritten by the United States Fire Insurance Company. The page features the Premier logo and an image of three people engaging socially, suggesting a focus on community and accessibility.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity and Group Accident Insurance Plans
summary: This page provides details on various group hospital fixed indemnity and accident insurance plans, specifically focusing on benefits such as daily hospital confinement, emergency room visits, surgeries, diagnostic tests, and office visits. The plans are categorized from '100 Plan' to '1000+ Plan', with corresponding benefit amounts and waiting periods. Additional benefits include accidental death coverage and hospital admission benefits, available across several states.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefits Overview
summary: This page outlines various benefits under the Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Policy. It details specific provisions, including the Hospital Admission Benefit, which applies when a covered person is hospitalized under certain conditions. The Daily Hospital Confinement Benefit is paid if the person is confined as an inpatient. The Daily Intensive Care/Coronary Care Unit Benefit covers ICU/CCU stays under specific conditions. The Daily Inpatient Surgery Benefit and Daily Inpatient Surgery Anesthesia Benefit are provided for surgeries due to covered accidents or sickness. Lastly, the Daily Emergency Room Visits Benefit covers emergency room treatments due to accidents or sickness, distinguishing between trauma centers and regular clinics. Each benefit has specific conditions and payment terms.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Description of Benefits
summary: This page outlines various benefits under a group hospital fixed indemnity plan, including daily outpatient surgery, anesthesia, physician office visits, and diagnostic radiology benefits. It details the conditions under which these benefits are payable, such as the necessity of medical procedures and the requirement for procedures to be ordered by licensed professionals. It also differentiates between inpatient and outpatient benefits for diagnostic radiology and laboratory tests, specifying eligibility criteria for coverage.

title: Group Accident Benefits Description
summary: This page outlines the benefits available under a group accident policy. It details various coverage areas, including Hospital Admission, Daily Hospital Confinement, Daily Physician’s Office Visits, Daily Inpatient and Outpatient Surgery Anesthesia, Daily Intensive Care/Coronary Care Unit, and Daily Emergency Room Visits for Sickness and Injury. Each benefit has specific conditions for eligibility and termination dates, such as hospital stay duration or policy end date.

title: Group Accident Description of Benefits
summary: This page outlines the benefits provided under a group accident policy for both inpatient and outpatient services. It includes details about the Daily Inpatient and Outpatient Surgery Benefits, which cover medically necessary surgeries resulting from accidents or sickness. It also describes the Daily Inpatient and Outpatient Diagnostic Radiology, X-ray, and Imaging Benefits, specifying conditions for receiving these benefits. Furthermore, it explains the Daily Inpatient and Outpatient Laboratory Test Benefits, highlighting the criteria for eligibility and the scope of covered laboratory tests.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefit Exclusions
summary: This page outlines the exclusions for the Limited Fixed Indemnity insurance portion of a membership. It lists various conditions and scenarios where coverage is not provided, including suicide, acts of war, certain medical treatments like mental illness or substance abuse, injuries involving illegal activities, and experimental procedures. It also excludes services related to pregnancy, elective abortions, and specific dental and orthodontic treatments, among others.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefit Exclusions
summary: Page 8 outlines specific exclusions under the Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity policy. Exclusions include treatments such as blood or plasma transfusions and routine vision care. Accidents involving motor vehicles without a valid license are not covered, nor are certain travel-related incidents, like aerial navigation without proper licensing. The policy also excludes elective or cosmetic surgeries, and physiotherapy services unless specified. A pre-existing conditions limitation is noted, excluding coverage for the first 12 months. The policy emphasizes its limitations, stating it is not comprehensive medical insurance and not a substitute for major medical coverage.

title: Group Accident Benefit Exclusions
summary: This page outlines exclusions for group accident benefits, detailing circumstances under which losses are not covered. These include self-inflicted injuries, war-related incidents, injuries during military service, participation in riots, and injuries from illegal activities. Exclusions also cover medical conditions like mental disorders, intoxication, treatment not related to a covered accident, and specific conditions such as heart attacks and pregnancy-related issues. Additional exclusions involve injuries during illegal activities, motorized races, and other specified medical conditions.

title: Group Accident Benefit Exclusions (Continued)
summary: This page outlines specific exclusions from group accident benefits. It lists various medical and non-medical scenarios where expenses are not covered, such as treatment for TMJ disorders, dental care unrelated to accidents, certain blood treatments, and eye-related services. It also excludes accidents involving unlicensed motor vehicle operation, specific kinds of travel, participation in sports, and elective surgeries. The policy emphasizes that benefits are only payable for specific losses from accidents and not for sickness or comprehensive medical coverage.

title: Termination of Insurance Policies
summary: This page outlines the conditions under which insurance policies can be terminated for policyholders, insured individuals, and dependents. The Policy Termination Date describes automatic termination conditions, such as the policy expiration date or failure to pay premiums. It also explains the process for termination by the policyholder or company, including refund policies for overpaid premiums. The Insured Person’s Termination Date lists conditions like ineligibility or active military duty. The Dependent’s Termination Date covers situations like policy termination or dependent status change. At the bottom, there are details about insurance premiums underwritten by the United States Fire Insurance Company, including rates for various membership tiers.

title: NCE Association Membership Information
summary: This page provides details about the National Congress of Employers (NCE) membership, which offers benefits to small and medium-sized businesses. It outlines the membership process, including receiving a membership packet and ID cards after successful payment. The page explains the Premier Plan Insured Benefits, highlighting that it is a limited benefit accident-only plan. It also covers insurance eligibility information, specifying criteria for Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity and Group Accident Insurance Plans, including age limits and conditions for eligibility.

title: NCE Association Membership Benefits Overview
summary: This page outlines the benefits provided by NCE Association Membership, highlighting that there are no waiting periods or pre-existing condition limitations. Members receive discounts on medical services through the First Health Network, including pharmacy, vision, dental, hearing, and alternative care. The GapAfford Plus program offers savings on medical expenses without deductibles, medical exams, or age restrictions. Additionally, members can access a network of providers across all 50 states for reduced out-of-pocket costs.

title: NCE Association Membership Benefits - GapAfford Plus Overview
summary: The page details the various benefits available under the GapAfford Plus program for NCE Association members, including discounts on prescription medications, dental services, vision care, and medical supplies. Key highlights include prescription discounts with a nationwide pharmacy network, dental savings through the Aetna Dental Access® Network, and vision care through The OUTLOOK Vision Network. Additional benefits include savings on hearing aids, imaging services, chiropractic care, laboratory tests, and vitamins. The program also offers 24/7 access to health information and nurse help lines.
